data.title: Tarot Garden
data.meta_description: The Tarot Garden is an art park designed and self-financed by French-American artist Niki de Saint Phalle between 1979 and 1996. Inspired by the Parque Guell in Barcelona and the Parco dei Mostri in Bomarzo, the park contains a series of large, colourful sculptures inspired by the major arcana ...
data.text:
The park is located on the southern slope of the Garavicchio hill in the municipality of Capalbio. Twenty-two colourful sculptures of different shapes and sizes, each dedicated to a tarot figure, accompany visitors in a magical and evocative experience. The sculptures stand in the midst of nature and in some of them, such as the Empress-Sphinx, it is even possible to enter.

For the creation of the park, Niki de Saint Phalle collaborated with skilled workers and other contemporary artists.

At the artist's behest, no guided tours are organised in the theme park to let everyone interpret the figures differently.

Price:

Full price: € 14.00

Reduced price (children and young people aged 7 to 22, over 65, Capalbio residents, groups of min. 25 people, tour guides with valid card): € 9,00

Reduced price (elementary, middle and high school students, groups of min. 10 people): € 7,00/person

Free admission for children under the age of 7, disabled people with disabilities over 74% and accompanying persons, school chaperones (1 for every 10 students)

Only online ticket purchase guarantees admission. Tickets can be purchased here: https: //www.ticketlandia.com/m/il-giardino-dei-tarocchi

Prices always updated on the official website: https: //ilgiardinodeitarocchi.it/visit/
